stat_description.ATK: Damage inflicted on each basic attack
stat_description.ATK_SPEED: Number of attacks per second. Maximum 2.5.
stat_description.CRIT_CHANCE: Critical hits deal 2x more damage. Abilities cannot crit by default. Crit chance over 100% is converted to Crit power.
stat_description.CRIT_POWER: Multiplier for critical hits damage, healing and buffs
stat_description.HP: Pokémon is knocked out when it no longer has Health Points
stat_description.MAX_PP: Amount of PP required to cast ability. Pokemons receive PP over time (10 per second), when attacking (5 per attack) and when receiving damage (10% of incoming damage)
stat_description.AP: Increase SPECIAL and ability effects in various ways.
stat_description.SHIELD: Temporary health points, cannot be healed.

status_description.BURN: Deals 5% of max HP as TRUE every second. Reduce healing by 50%.
status_description.SILENCE: Prevents casting abilities and gaining PP
status_description.POISONNED: Deals 5% of max HP per stack as TRUE every second. Can stack up to 3 times by default.
status_description.PROTECT: Protects from any source of damage, but prevents healing and PP gain. Enemies will avoid targeting a protected unit.
status_description.SLEEP: Prevents moving, dodging or attacking. Receiving attacks reduces the duration of the effect.
status_description.CONFUSION: Force to change target all the time and sometimes deal damage to itself
status_description.RAGE: Double damage and speed, half shield, healing, freeze and sleep durations, lose PROTECT. All units become RAGE after 35 seconds of fight.
status_description.RESURECTION: Prevents KO once, restoring to max HP
status_description.PARALYSIS: Reduce ATK_SPEED and move speed by 40%, prevents dodging attacks
status_description.POKERUS: Every 2 seconds, gain 1 ATK and 10% AP before infecting 2 adjacent allies with POKERUS
status_description.CHARM: Prevents attacking the target and forces to get closer to it
status_description.CURSE: KOs the cursed Pokémon after some time
status_description.LOCKED: Prevents moving and sets RANGE to 1

faq.official_game_answer: No, this is a fan game; made by fans, for fans. All rights/credits to Pokemon Company.
faq.how_pokemon_evolve_answer: You need 3 copies of the same Pokémon to get the evolution. The 3 Pokémons will merge to give the evolved Pokémon. Hatch Pokemon that come from eggs evolve automatically with time every 5 stages.
faq.income_answer: You get 5 gold per round whether you draw, win or lose. You get 1 bonus income per 10 gold saved. A maximum of 5 bonus income accrued at 50 saved gold. You get 1 bonus gold if you win. If you win multiple times, you will also gain extra gold; one bonus gold for every victory/defeat, up to 5 bonus gold for 5 streak wins / 5 streak defeat. Wins/Defeats against PVE are not taken into account.
faq.collection: What is the purpose of the collection/booster ?
faq.collection_answer: When opening boosters, you get Pokémon shards. Those shards are specific to every Pokémon. In the collection tab, you can buy Pokémon emotions with those shards. You can see Pokémon emotions as a detailed customization. When selecting an emotion Pokémon portrait, the Pokémon will appear everywhere with the same emotion portrait that you have selected. Eveyone will see the emotion that you picked for this Pokémon. Moreover, if you have selected a shiny emotion, the Pokémon will appear shiny to everyone else.
faq.avatars: How do I get new avatars ?
faq.avatars_answer: When buying a Pokémon emotion, it will be available in your profile avatar list.
faq.boosters_answer: You gain boosters each time you level up.
faq.level_answer: You gain experience each time you finish a game. If you finish first, you'll get 700 xp, if you finish last, you'll get 100 xp.
faq.sprite: It seems some sprites are missing ?
faq.sprite_answer2: If you want the missing sprites to be added, please consider donating to Pokémon autochess. Every donation will be used to pay spriters to make sprites for everyone.
faq.sprite_answer1: Sprites of Pokémon auto chess are based on
faq.mythical: How do I get unique / legendary Pokémons ?
faq.mythical_answer: On stages 10 and 20, portals with synergy symbols will appear. Entering a portal will give the opportunity to select one of six powerful Pokemon, with each symbol guaranteeing a synergy of one of the Pokemon. If no portal is entered, all Pokemon options will be entirely random. Symbols are determined by the synergy levels reached by each remaining player, with 4 symbols per player chosen randomly from a pool of one symbol per each of their reached synergy levels.
faq.ditto_answer: Ditto creates a plain copy of the unit you hover and drop it over. Each Pokémon in shop has a 0.5% chance to be a Ditto at every roll. You can't copy unique and hatch Pokémon.
faq.items_answer: You can gain item components by winning PvE rounds or picking one in an item carousel. You can combine two item components to create a powerful tier 2 item. Every Pokémon can hold up to 3 items. The crafting list of all items is available in the wiki, in the items section.
faq.bots_answer: Bots are created by other players. Bots are theme-based, a mewtwo bot will always have an mewtwo in its team at a certain time in the game. Bots have a list of predefined teams at each stage.
faq.create_bot: Can i create my own bot ?
faq.create_bot_answer: Sure. You'll need to be at least level 20 to unlock the Bot Builder gadget. You can use it to create and submit your bot, it will be sent in the #bot-creation channel on Discord for a review by the bot reviewers team.
faq.elo: How does the elo system work ?
faq.elo_answer: The elo system in Pokemon Auto Chess works the same as in other elo based games like Chess, Lol, Starcraft etc... To gain elo points, you need to beat other players. The higher your opponent's elo, the more elo you will gain by defeating him, and vice versa. If you don't play for 10 days, your elo will start to decay (-10 elo/day).
faq.missing_points: I didn't get elo points in my last game, why ?
faq.missing_points_answer: The game needs to be finished in order to win/lose elo points. If someone is still in game, you need to wait. Bots do not give elo, only human players are accounted for elo rating. It is also possible that the game had elo disabled ("Just for fun" mode)
faq.damage: What are the special damages and physical damages ?
faq.damage_answer: Auto attacks mostly deal Physical damage, while Abilities mostly deal Special damage. Some abilities however can deal true damage or physical damage.
faq.defense: Can you tell me how defense works? Is it flat damage reduction?
faq.defense_answer: Same system as League of Legends: damage: atk / (1+(0.1*def)). Defense works for physical damage, special defense for special damage
faq.shiny: How do you get shiny Pokémons ?
faq.shiny_answer: You get experience points by playing games. With enough experience, you level up and get a booster pack. Each booster pack gives shards for random Pokémon. Use these shards to purchase the shiny emotes of a Pokémon in the Collection page, then you will get that one Pokémon as a shiny ingame.

faq.mobile: Will there be a mobile version one day ?

faq.code_answer: TypeScript, Phaser, Colyseus. If you want to contribute

loading_hints.tab_out: Don't tab out! Loading is paused when this browser window is inactive.

loading_hints.avatar: To change your player avatar, play games to earn XP and level up. Each level grants you a booster which when opened gives you shards that can be spent in the Collection menu to buy new avatars.

wiki.data_description: Various data about the game for the geeks
wiki.tiers_by_level_description: The odds of getting a certain rarity of Pokémon in your shop changes with your player level. The higher the level, the higher the rarity and the cost in the shop.
wiki.experience_by_rank_description: You gain experience points at the end of each game based on your final rank. Every 1000 XP, you level up and gain one booster.
wiki.booster_rarity_probability_description: The chances to find a Pokémon in a booster pack depends on its rarity.
wiki.ditto_rate: Chance to find Ditto in shop
wiki.kecleon_rate: Chance to find Kecleon in stage 10 propositions
wiki.arceus_rate: Chance to find Arceus in stage 20 propositions
wiki.fishing_rarity_rate_description: The quality of the rod you use to fish influences the rarity of the Pokémon you can catch.
wiki.pool_size_per_category_description: The pokemons you find in shops are taken from a pool shared by all players. The number of specimens of each Pokémon in the pool depends on its rarity and its number of evolution stages.
